channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: I think its a ash tree which looks like its dead or dying. I was told years ago it wouldnt last very long., 14th April
item.description:
Its is on council owned land on the Old Gloucester Road opposite Hayden Allotments. Situated behind number 25 & 27 William Gough Close, Cheltenham GL51 0QL. The Branches overhang the gardens and I'm worried if it is dead and we have strong winds it could fall into either mine or my neighbours gardens or on people walking their dogs, as lots of people use this path/grass area.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 27, William Gough Close, Hesters Way, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Ash Tree located on Highway land

item.title: More bins required, 14th April
item.description:
Bins are over flowing and rubbish is blowing about. I have suggested more bins before, I would also like to suggest, bins with lids or covered bins, as the linet in tne one in the photo regularly blows inside out

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 59, Blackberry Grove, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Whole stretch of road has significantly large and dangerous potholes on the left edge of the road. They are constantly getting deeper and wider. Traffic needs to drive in the middle of the road to avoid them, which given the speed of the road makes it dangerous. Potholes were there when the road was closed for the new link road works, not repaired and have got progressively bigger., 14th April
item.description:
After Crickley Hill Country Park turning, continuing towards turning to Ullenwood Court.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): B4070, Coberley, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 20mph marking should be 30mph marking, 14th April
item.description:
On the roundabout between Hatherly Road and Hatherley Lane there is a new 20mph sign coming off on the Hatherly Road,before Hatherly Brake, implying that the speed restrictions continue the length of Hatherly Road. I assume it should have been a 30mph sign as there are no indications of speed restrictions further down Hatherly Road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 265, Hatherley Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues
